page.title: 20EDUCATION
page.content: Most children begin their education at Little Bytham Primary School (in the next block). There is no state nursery education in Lincolnshire closer than Grantham. Many children attend a play- group in nearby Castle Bytham. Some go to private nursery classes and schools elsewhere. Little Bytham School has 2 teachers. The 34 children come from L.Bytham, Creeton, Counthorpe and Careby. Careby children travel by taxi. A few go to independent schools in Witham on the Hill, Baston or Stamford. All children sit a selection exam at 11. If selected they go to single-sex endowed schools in Stamford (fees paid by the LEA). If not they go to one of Stamford's 2 secondary moderns (a few cross the border to a comprehensive in Leicestershire). This system is due to change in 1987.
